key.name: order
key.description: The order of the window buttons (e.g. :minimize,maximize,close). Colon represents the shit in the middle.

key.name: theme
key.description: The name of the theme to use

key.name: pinch
key.description: Use custom button order or the order pinch settings from mutter/metacity

key.name: do-metacity
key.description: Try to use the theme with the same name as the current metacity theme ('/apps/metacity/general/theme')

key.name: box-left
key.summary: Box to put left buttons in
key.description: 'Left' : buttons placed in the left box (activities + window title button); 'Right': buttons placed in the right box (status area); 'Middle': buttons placed in the centre box (date/time, unless you have (e.g.) Frippery Move Clock extension, in which case the centre box is empty and in between the left and right boxes)

key.name: box-right
key.summary: Box to put right buttons in
key.description: 'Left' : buttons placed in the left box (activities + window title button); 'Right': buttons placed in the right box (status area); 'Middle': buttons placed in the centre box (date/time, unless you have (e.g.) Frippery Move Clock extension, in which case the centre box is empty and in between the left and right boxes)

key.name: position-left
key.description: 1 means 'first item from the left', 2 means 'second item from the left', and so on. Use negative numbers to mean 'from the right' (-1 is 'first item from the right').

key.name: position-right
key.description: 1 means 'first item from the left', 2 means 'second item from the left', and so on. Use negative numbers to mean 'from the right' (-1 is 'first item from the right').

key.name: onlymax
key.description: Prioritise controlling windows which are maximized.

key.name: hideonnomax
key.summary: Hide if there are no maximized windows
key.description: Hide the window buttons if there are no maximized windows to control. Only works if controling only maximized windows. Only has any effect is the 'onlymax' option is set.
